intro: Poliomintha conjunctrix, commonly known as the clustered blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically hairy and arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Poliomintha conjunctrix is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
